title: Democrats Negotiate Tax, Healthcare Provisions as Biden Seeks Deal This Week
sub_head: Party seeks legislative framework before Glasgow climate summit and to win support for separate infrastructure package
body:
WASHINGTONâ€”Democrats are sprinting to wrap up negotiations over their social-spending and climate bill, hoping by this weekend to resolve disagreements on issues including tax policy and healthcare.
Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer (D., N.Y.) said Monday there were three to four open issues. Lawmakers and aides said major policy areas, including the tax increases to pay for the package, Medicare and Medicaid provisions and a paid leave program, remain unresolved. The bill, initially drafted at $3.5 trillion, is now expected to cost between $1.5 trillion and $2 trillion.
